item.description:
Tell No One (Ne le dis à personne) by Guillaume Canet (2006, 125 min.). A French box-office phenomenon, Guillaume Canet?s take on Harlen Coben?s best-selling novel is an energetic blend of Hollywood thrills and French cinematic style. François Cluzet plays a widower who comes under renewed suspicion when his wife?s murder case is re-opened, and receives a mysterious e-mail containing a clue only she would know. What follows is a somewhat convoluted take on the Hitchcockian ?wronged man? format, but one that keeps the thrill-o-meter on high and the suspension of disbelief even more so, largely due to its highly credible cast. Description adapted from BBC.

Could one of Harlan Coben's good thrillers actually be made into a good film? It would seem to be a better shot than waiting for the Hollywood release: The film won César awards for Best Director and Best Actor.

Following the film, we'll stop at a local eatery to discuss. The French Film Festival is usually very popular, and it might be a good idea to get your ticket online before the day of the film.
